div.a: Community Update and Health Alert #8 - More Stringent Stay-at-Home Orders and New Temporary Grading Policy

div.div: This Edition Covers the start of Vista's Virtual School!

div.div: RMS New Student Orientation Night 4:30-7:30 PM/Noche de Orientación para Nuevos Estudiantes de RMS 4:30-7:30 p.m.
Roosevelt Middle School, 850 Sagewood Dr, Oceanside, CA 92057, USA @ 4:30PM - 7:30PM

li.p: Based on consultation with the San Diego County Office of Education and the San Diego County Health and Human Services, Vista Unified School District will close all schools and programs starting on Monday, March 16, 2020 through the end of spring break. We will reopen Vista Virtual Schools on Monday, April 6, 2020. This decision was made to curb the potential transmission of the coronavirus (COVID-19).

div.p: Our vision in Vista Unified School District is to be the model of educational excellence and innovation.

p.br:
We can do our part to flatten the coronavirus curve by taking proactive steps to mitigate the spread. During the coronavirus task force briefing at the White House on Tuesday evening, Dr. Anthony Fauci, Director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, identified that the best way to flatten the curve is to “interfere with the natural flow of the outbreak.” The best way to interfere with the natural flow is to promote social distancing before there is a problem in our community.
VUSD Health and Safety Site
